intro: Nephroia, commonly known as the kidney fern, is a type of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, kidney-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and thrives in humid climates. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Nephroia plays an important role in its ecosystem by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms.
